attributes.action: Award former Tottenham Hotspur player and manager Bill Nicholson a posthumous Knighthood
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Bill Nicholson served Tottenham Hotspur as a player, coach, manager, scout and president before he passed away in 2004. He managed one of the greatest ever footballing sides - the 1961 double winning Spurs team. Under Nicholson Spurs became the first British club to win a European trophy, and then in 1972 the first British side to win two different trophies. Nicholson is a legend in the game and one of the greatest managers ever. We believe he deserves a posthumous knighthood.

rejection.details: sorry, we are no longer accepting posthumous knighthood requests
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
